author: Special Correspondent
text:
Two functionaries of Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam – Jeyaraman and S.R. Gopi – on Wednesday appeared before Mathichiyam Inspector of Police after summons were served on them for an enquiry in connection with hurling of bombs on the urban district unit office of the ruling party.

Accompanied by party secretaries V. Veluchamy and G. Thalapathi and scores of partymen, they came to the police station around 10 a.m. After an enquiry held for nearly an hour by Inspector of Police Alagar, they left the police station.

A country-made bomb and lit kerosene-filled bottles were hurled on All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam party office on Panagal Road on Saturday night. No one was injured in the incident.
title: Two DMK functionaries appear before police
